summary: waterfowl parvovirus causes high morbidity and mortality in geese and Muscovy ducks. mortality rate ranges from 10 to 80%, and even up to 50%, resulting in economic losses to duck industry of china. pathogen isolation and identification and genomic sequence analysis were carried out to identify the exact pathogen that caused this disease. a novel nucleic acid amplification method—loop-mediated isothermal amplification (LAMP) has attracted intense attention. it relies on auto-cycling strand displacement DNA synthesis by the Bst DNA polymerase large fragment with high strand displacement activity. results can be judged by either turbidity, or end-products that can be visible to naked eyes. detection method quantitative loop-mediated isothermal amplification (qLAMP) was established. specificity of this method was determined by GPV and other duck-origin viruses, such as duck plague virus, duck tembusu virus, duck hepatitis virus, duck reovirus, and H9N2-AIV. the supernatant were filtered through a 0.22 m filter. the filtrate was inoculated into duck embryo fibroblasts (DEF) cells. the culture supernatant was harvested after 5 days post-inoculated for three passages. covy duck Hungary X75093 U22967 Muscovy duck China Primer Design A set of four primers and PCR primers were designed using an online program.
